docs.lead_paragraph: Candidates are confronting an electorate unsettled about the United States’ ability to control its future.

headline.main: Voters Show Darker Mood Than in 2000

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Randal C. Archibold in Los Angeles, Abby Goodnough in Boston, Kirk Johnson in Denver  and Sam Roberts and Megan Thee in New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — The quarterly profit at WellPoint, the largest United States health insurer, rose 7 percent, but an unexpected rise in the percentage of revenue used to cover medical costs helped push down its shares.
docs.snippet: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — The quarterly profit at WellPoint, the largest United States health insurer, rose 7 percent, but an unexpected rise in the percentage of revenue used to cover medical costs helped push down its shares.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge who ruled in 2005 that California’s broken prison medical care system amounted to cruel and unusual punishment dismissed the receiver who had been appointed to repair the system.

headline.main: Judge Replaces State Overseer of Health Care for Prisoners
headline.print_headline: Judge Replaces State Overseer Of Health Care For Prisoners

docs.snippet: A federal judge who ruled in 2005 that California’s broken prison medical care system amounted to cruel and unusual punishment dismissed the receiver who had been appointed to repair the system.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats cited the economy’s downturn as a reason to expand a health insurance program for children, but the House sustained President Bush’s veto of the measure.

headline.main: Veto Stands on Measure to Expand Health Plan
headline.print_headline: Veto Stands On Measure To Expand Health Plan

docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA - Pennsylvania Gov. Ed Rendell threw his political weight behind Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential candidacy on Wednesday afternoon, after months of courting by both Clintons, who hope that Mr. Rendell's endorsement can give her a boost in the New Jersey and Delaware primaries on Feb. 5.
docs.abstract: The campaign hopes his endorsement will resonate in neighboring New Jersey and Delaware, two states in the Feb. 5 primary bonanza.
docs.snippet: The campaign hopes his endorsement will resonate in neighboring New Jersey and Delaware, two states in the Feb. 5 primary bonanza.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Ambac Financial Group, one of the largest companies that insures against bond losses, said Tuesday that it was exploring "strategic alternatives" as it announced a $3.26 billion loss for its fourth quarter.

headline.main: Ambac Looks at 'Alternatives' After $3.26 Billion Loss

docs.abstract: The Ambac Financial Group, one of the largest companies that insures against bond losses, said Tuesday that it was exploring "strategic alternatives" as it announced a $3.26 billion loss for its fourth quarter. Ambac's shares surged more than 28 percent on the disclosure that it was in talks. In Wall Street's parlance, strategic alternatives mean, [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democratic leaders failed again on Wednesday to override President Bush’s veto of a bill to expand a popular children’s health insurance program.

headline.main: Veto of Children’s Health Plan Stands
headline.print_headline: Veto of Children’s Health Plan Stands

docs.lead_paragraph: After a rocky six months, Gov. Eliot Spitzer seems ready to negotiate with legislators, noting that he looks forward to receiving their “wisdom.” That is a wise move.
